thread.title: Colts coach Chuck Pagano 'supremely confident' about upcoming Pats game | The Blitz | with Jeff Howe & Karen Guregian
thread.title_full: Colts coach Chuck Pagano 'supremely confident' about upcoming Pats game | The Blitz | with Jeff Howe & Karen Guregian | Boston Herald

author: Adam Kurkjian
title: Colts coach Chuck Pagano 'supremely confident' about upcoming Pats game | The Blitz | with Jeff Howe & Karen Guregian
text:
FOXBORO -- The Colts took down the Texans Thursday night and now turn their attention to the undefeated Pats, who play the Cowboys on Sunday.
No matter what happens against Dallas and despite the fact that the Pats have been dominant at times this season, Colts coach Pagano is unwavering in his confidence that his team can take down its rival when New England travels to Lucas Oil Stadium on Sunday Night Football.
"Supremely confident," Pagano told reporters last night after the win, according to Pro Football Talk.
Pagano used the same terminology to describe his feelings about injured quarterback Andrew Luck's chances to play against the Jaguars. He didn't play.
When it came to Luck's availability for the Pats game, Pagano used the same phrase.
Pagano jokingly says he's "supremely confident" Luck will play vs Patriots. "He's getting better every single day -- he's really close."
â€” Mike Berman (@MikeBermanIndy) October 9, 2015 Still, part of this bravado may have to do with the way the season has played out for the Colts. After stumbling to an 0-2 start, Pagano gave a tearful, impassioned postgame speech after a close win over the Titans. The Colts followed with wins over the Jaguars and Texans to grab hold of first place in the AFC South.
But the Patriots are a whole different animal, especially considering the Deflategate aspect that has fanned the flames of this rivalry. Not that the Pats need any more bulletin board material for this game, but it's clear Pagano doesn't mind if he provides it, joking or not.
Either way, the Pats hope Pagano's supreme confidence has the same amount of spotty results going forward.
